author: R Sivaraman
text:
The work was published in 1623 , says Tamil researcher and litterateur

Researcher and activist N. Nandhivarman hands over a rare collection of William Shakespeare’s plays published in the 17th century to M. Murugesan, Archivist, National Archives, Puducherry (extreme left), on Tuesday. Ananda Ranga Ravichander (centre), the grandson of the legendary historian, is in the picture.— Photo: T. Singaravelou

A rare collection of William Shakespeare’s plays claimed to have been published in 1623 was handed over to the treasure trove of the National Archives of India, Record Centre, Puducherry by N. Nandhivarman, Tamil researcher, litterateur and activist.

The uniqueness of the collection relates to its age and the set of illustrations not common in other Shakespeare editions. The National Archives of India, Puducherry, will house this rare edition for the researchers to peruse the collection.

Mr. Nandhivarman said, “Three volumes of the plays have no mention of the year of publication as the front pages were attacked by termites. Later, the books were repaired and rebound. Originally it was presented to me by M.T. Black, president of Mann Marbles Limited, Isles of Man in 1988. I was a granite exporter at that time and was his representative in India to certify the quality of other exporter’s products. He entrusted the literary treasure with me fearing that after his time, there would be none in the family to preserve it. He told me that it was a 1623 edition, I remember.”

After receiving the rare collection, Archivist M. Murugesan said, “We will preserve the collection for posterity to conduct research. First, we will give fumigation treatment and keep it in our collection. Anyone can access the archives from National Archives of India.”

According to Mr. Nandhivarman, there was a Great Fire in London of 1666 and unknown number of copies got destroyed in the fire. But in 1664 through the third folio edition, the second enlarged issue of Shakespeare’s plays, generally regarded as the rarest of 17{+t}{+h}century folio editions was published by the same publishers and same company.

Isle of Man in London had preserved the older versions that escaped the Great Fire, Mr Mr. Nandhivarman said.
title: National Archives gets rare edition of Shakespearean plays
